abstract.p: Mike Atwood letter on Oct 5 article about decisions doctors face treating patients holds that patients know what is best for them (S)

block.p: Re ''Give Up? No Way. On a Matter of Life or Death, a Patient Is Overruled.'' (Oct. 5): According to the column, medical ethics apparently permits a team of doctors to hold down a screaming but fully rational patient, sedate him and shove a tube down his throat.
The patient was no doubt aware that once that tube was in place, it would be almost impossible for his family to direct its removal.
Forcible treatment in the face of energetic, rational opposition by a patient is not only unethical, it is probably illegal.
